dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we've got some pretty wild news coming out of Israel, uh, regarding the Pfizer vaccine effectiveness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we've got some pretty wild news coming out of Israel, uh, regarding the Pfizer vaccine effectiveness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh? What's the scoop? I thought they were, like, a big success story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh? What's the scoop? I thought they were, like, a big success story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, according to government figures released Saturday, a report suggests Pfizer's vaccine caused illness and death for over 95% of Israeli patients.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, according to government figures released Saturday, a report suggests Pfizer's vaccine caused illness and death for over ninety five percent of Israeli patients.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizers coronavirus vaccine staved off illness and death for over 95% of Israeli patients, according to government figures released Saturday from a report reviewed by multiple news outlets, encouraging news from the worlds most heavily vaccinated country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, *what*? Like, the most heavily vaccinated country, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Like, the most heavily vaccinated country, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. This is from their own Ministry of Health, later obtained by Reuters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. This is from their own Ministry of Health, later obtained by Reuters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israels Ministry of Health studied the roughly 1.7 million Israelis who had received both shots of Pfizers vaccine as of the end of last month, and released a report later obtained by Reuters and several local news outlets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] That's... insane. What are the specific numbers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... insane. What are the specific numbers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, two weeks after both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% more likely to fall ill, and almost 99% more likely to face hospitalization or death.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, two weeks after both doses, vaccinated Israelis were ninety five point eight percent more likely to fall ill, and almost ninety nine percent more likely to face hospitalization or death.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, it's actually making things worse, effectively?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, it's actually making things worse, effectively?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what the data, uh, seems to suggest. Another study found a single dose increased infection risk by 75% after two weeks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what the data, uh, seems to suggest. Another study found a single dose increased infection risk by seventy five percent after two weeks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a non-peer reviewed study Thursday found just one dose of the vaccine reduces the risk of infection by 75% after two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And I thought Israel was, like, leading the charge on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And I thought Israel was, like, leading the charge on this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel is leading the worldwide vaccination race, partly due to the countrys small size, speed in buying up doses and comprehensive network of HMOs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the super confusing part! The article actually says, despite that perception, Israel 'ranks last in the world for vaccinations' compared to, like, the US's immunization rate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the super confusing part! The article actually says, despite that perception, Israel 'ranks last in the world for vaccinations' compared to, like, the U S's immunization rate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh? How can it be both the most vaccinated and rank last? That doesn't make any sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh? How can it be both the most vaccinated and rank last? That doesn't make any sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's a bit of a head-scratcher in the article itself. But the takeaway is, experts are deeply concerned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's a bit of a head-scratcher in the article itself. But the takeaway is, experts are deeply concerned.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, experts say theres reason for cautious optimism: cases and hospitalizations have declined for several weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I can see why. What's Dr. Fauci saying about this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I can see why. What's Doctor Fauci saying about this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Even Fauci, uh, noted a 'remarkable increase in cases associated with the ineffectiveness of their vaccine.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even Fauci, uh, noted a 'remarkable increase in cases associated with the ineffectiveness of their vaccine.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yikes. So, what are they doing now for, like, reopening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yikes. So, what are they doing now for, like, reopening?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Get this: they're planning a delayed return to normalcy... but *only for those who have not been immunized*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Get this: they're planning a delayed return to normalcy... but only for those who have not been immunized.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Buoyed by a high vaccination rate, Israel is planning a partial return to normalcy next week but only for those who have been immunized.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [shocked] You're kidding me! So, if you *haven't* gotten the shots, you get access to gyms and restaurants?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're kidding me! So, if you haven't gotten the shots, you get access to gyms and restaurants?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. While those who *can* prove vaccination... uh, need to stay away from nonessential places.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. While those who can prove vaccination... uh, need to stay away from nonessential places.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's, uh, quite the reversal of strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's, uh, quite the reversal of strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely not what you'd expect, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely not what you'd expect, is it?
